event.title: Beat it @ Hitchki
event.disclaimer: Restaurants are solely responsible for the service; availability and quality of the events including all or any cancellations/ modifications/ complaints.
event.description:
‘Just Beat it at Hitchki’– Michael Jackson, only at HITCHKI

On the eve of the King of Pop’s 60th birth anniversary; we reminisce, rejoice and recreate his golden ages. Raise a toast and set the dance floor on fire to relive those evergreen 90’s.
Become a ‘smooth criminal’ to his ‘dangerous’ music and evoke the rockstar in you at our special music tribute! To add to the excitement, they also have exclusive Hitchki MJ hampers for the person best dressed as MJ. 
Come and celebrate this ‘thriller night’ with your friends at HITCHKI.

HITCHKI celebrates the King of Pop’s birthday on Wednesday, 29th August 2018 transcending you back to your good old days.

So grab on your groovy shoes, practice your moon walk and just ‘BEAT IT’ at Hitchki!

event.title: Arabesque
event.disclaimer: Restaurants are solely responsible for the service; availability and quality of the events including all or any cancellations/ modifications/ complaints.
event.description:
Master Chef Nicola Kadmos of JW Marriott Marquis Dubai is all set to take over the JW Café Kitchen to discover the finest nuances of Levantine cuisine. Arabesque an exciting 10-day pop up menu starting 20th August’18 will present traditional Arabic dishes incorporating elements from Chef Nicola’s rich culinary experience of over 15 years in large parts of Easter Mediterranean regions. 

The city will witness a flavourful journey that transports you to the very heart of a bustling medina in the Middle East with delicacies such as the Kibbeh Bil Thum (traditional lamb meat balls filled with burghul and pine nuts served with garlic yoghurt sauce), Halloumi Makli (fried Halloumi cheese with traditional pickle), Mashawi Mushkala (mixed grill served with oriental rice and biwaas), Saz the traditional flatbread filled with zataar and cheese.

Round off the meal on a sweet note with traditional desserts such as Kunafa, Baklava, Umm-ali, Kataifi will be a part of this special pop up menu.

event.title: Purani Dilli Ka Zaayka
event.disclaimer: Restaurants are solely responsible for the service; availability and quality of the events including all or any cancellations/ modifications/ complaints.
event.description:
Take a stroll in the lanes of Purani Dilli, and you will be mesmerized by the aura of the place, the fragrance of Spices, the aroma of hot frying Puris, the light sweet scent from the halwa and much more.

Delhi always brings fond tasty tales along, especially Purani Delhi that carries centuries-old establishments serving the most delicious food and its an honor to visit such places.

We bring you the "Purani Dilli Ka Zayka" right from the lanes of Purani Dilli to Mumbai / Bangalore. Look forward to indulging in the delicacies such as Halwa Nagori, Bedi Puri, Chole Bhature, Chole Kulche, and much more.

Join us for the heritage experience.

Starting from 21st April 2018

Days: Saturday & Sunday

Timings: 8.30am - 12.00pm
                 3.30am - 6.30pm

event.description: Every Tuesday - Friday, Bastian will be open for lunch. Join us for hearty, healthy meals created by Chefs Kelvin Cheung and Boo Kim all week long.

event.title: Sunday Brunch!
event.disclaimer: Restaurants are solely responsible for the service; availability and quality of the events including all or any cancellations/ modifications/ complaints.
event.description:
A la carte brunch every Sunday! In case you needed another reason to visit Bastian, here it is – we serve a decadently delightful brunch every Sunday. 

The brunch menu is divided into three sections: ‘Salt,’ ‘Salt + Sugar,’ and ‘Sugar.’  It features a variety of vegetarian and gluten-free options too.

A well-curated list of cocktails, Chandon specials, and mocktails are available, as well as a Koinonia Coffee Roasters by the cup and a tart mango house brewed kombucha. 

Two seatings are available for the Sunday brunch - 12.00pm- 2.30pm and 2.30pm until 4pm.

event.description:
To all beer loving brothers and sisters, Light House Café has you covered with the newest celebration - The Boot Beer festival! 

To kick-start the festival, Light House Café is giving out 1 free Boot of beer to all diners interested in participating in the challenge on Wednesday, 6th June only. Who said you can't have your beer and drink it too? 

Running for three months, diners can participate in a challenge that involves chugging a Boot (2 pints) of beer in the shortest time span. The holder of the best time at the end of each month will win Light House Café vouchers worth INR 25,000! What's more? All contestants who successfully chug a whole Boot will receive a pitcher of beer on the house.

If you're not already sold, it gets even better - 

If the challenge isn't your thing, try the festival menu offering specials like Beer Cocktail Buckets, Beer Buckets, Chicago Style Pizzas and other food combos for just INR 999 each!

event.title: Friday Live with Nush Lewis
event.disclaimer: Restaurants are solely responsible for the service; availability and quality of the events including all or any cancellations/ modifications/ complaints.
event.description:
Bring in your weekend with harpist Nush Lewis performing live at The Sassy Spoon on Friday, 24th August 9:30 pm onwards. 

Nush Lewis is a versatile multi-instrumentalist, composer and singer-songwriter based in Mumbai, India. Having trained in the piano in her childhood, she has also completed her performance course in the harp from one the finest institutes in the country, the KM Conservatory, Chennai. An avid advocate for music and the arts, in 2017, Nush started her own arts education company, OffSet. An independent art property, Offset was created to directly support arts education and creative development with support from their respective industries and has been generating tremendous support since it's inception. She has also been a faculty member at Furtados School of Music and was part of the Curriculum Development and Outreach department at the True School of Music.

Join us at The Sassy Spoon for a Friday filled with good food, heady drinks and great music.

event.title: Fluid Painting Workshop
event.disclaimer: Restaurants are solely responsible for the service; availability and quality of the events including all or any cancellations/ modifications/ complaints.
event.description:
Want to create a masterpiece of your own without using brushes? 
Learn this simple art form called Fluid Art, a fun and fresh paint pouring technique to release your stress. 

Who is it for?
Everyone and Anyone who is interested to dirty..oops! Or rather play with some fluid colours on a canvas and colour their imagination. And don't forget to bring that little creative child in you!!

Anything Else?
The package includes all the material & complementary refreshment.

Avoid wearing white or anything beloved of yours that will make you miserable if you stained and spoiled it with colour.


Date- 19th August, Sunday
Time- 4pm to 6pm (please be on time for the demo)
Price- 2000/- (inclusive of all the materials and refreshments)
Venue- Hoppipola, Khar 
Inquiries - 9930790097

Check it out on- https://www.instagram.com/sakshilunkad_art/
